t: The Steadfast Love of God Endures
To the choirmaster. A Maskil of David, when Doeg, the Edomite, came and told Saul, “David has come to the house of Ahimelech.”
Why*pn do you boast of evil, O mighty man? The*ld steadfast love of God endures all the day.
Your*ln tongue plots destruction, like*ld a sharp razor, you worker of deceit.
You*ln love evil more than good, and*ld lying more than speaking what is right. Selah*ig
You*ln love all words that devour, O*ld deceitful tongue.
But*pn God will break you down forever; he*ld will snatch and tear you from your tent; he*ld will uproot you from the land of the living. Selah*ig
The*ln righteous shall see and fear, and*ld shall laugh at him, saying,
“See*ln the man who would not make God*ld his refuge, but*ln trusted in the abundance of his riches and*ld sought refuge in his own destruction!”
But*pn I am like a green olive tree in*ld the house of God. I*ln trust in the steadfast love of God forever*ld and ever.
I*ln will thank you forever, because*ld you have done it. I*ln will wait for your name, for it is good, in*ld the presence of the godly.
